thread.title: 2 dead, 10 trapped in central China landslide
thread.title_full: 2 dead, 10 trapped in central China landslide

title: 2 dead, 10 trapped in central China landslide
text:
2 dead, 10 trapped in central China landslide Xinhua | Updated: 2017-01-21 15:23 Rescuers work at the landslide site in Nanzhang county, Central China's Hubei province, Jan 20, 2017. [Photo/Xinhua] WUHAN -- At least two people have been confirmed killed and another 10 are missing after a landslide hit a hotel in Central China's Hubei province on Friday night.
A total of 15 people were trapped in the Mirage Hotel in Nanzhang county at around 7:30 p.m. Friday when around 3,000 cubic meters of debris slid down a slope behind the hotel, said the firefighter in charge of the rescue. 
Rescuers have pulled five survivors from the debris, two of whom died in hospital. 
A three-storey building collapsed, trapping hotel workers and guests in the restaurant on the first floor. 
Rescue work is continuing.
